reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have been following this game's development for a while now and I have to say a couple things (TL;DR on the end) :

Pros :
- The art is awesome. I didn't see much games with as smooth animations as Planet Centauri. Overall, there is an unique atompshere in Planet Centauri and you won't find it in Terraria or Starbound. Every biome feels different especially thanks to the excellent color managment.

- The engine has a LOT of potential. It can run on toasters and it's not even optimized yet. As a hobbyist developer, even in an early state, it is pretty usable and well designed. Come back in a couple months (/years more probably), and you'll probably get pretty neat modding. Something more evolved than the minimal/nearly useless Starbound modding at least. If it is as nearly moddable as King Arthur's Gold, I'm spending the rest of my life modding this game. Well, probably not my entire life (hopefully).

- The music isn't in a chiptune style, so the game doesn't really fall in the retro" games box and that's good as it is IMO. The ambiance really matches up what the biomes should give. They're not so much matching my music tastes
date: but I really like some of the pieces - Shadow Forest is my favourite.\n\n- The developers are really dedicated. I think the lead coder forgot any definition of "holidays" or "week-ends". Don't bother them with such really strange words. Just give a look at the count of their answers (onilink's and Planet Centauri's). There's also an IRC channel on irc.mibbit.net:6667 #centauri if you want to talk out to the lead coder or to some other players (the channel is nearly unpopulated as it is now
recommended: come!)\n\n- Planned features. Just look at them by yourself. Even the electronics part
voteText:
could be a whole game by itself.

- Multiplayer is coming very soon.

Cons:
- Gameplay is pretty much empty right now. It's being improved over releases
helpfulPercent: but the game relies more on being an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ against enemies (i.e. when locking yourself up somewhere you can attack enemies but so they can't attack you). Some weapons get also overpowered at some point so there will be basically no fun at least until the 2nd underground layer. Pretty sure improving it is one of the devs' focus right now.\n\n- The game lifetime is limited. You can reach up the "end" of the game (i.e. get the dragon scale armor right now
votesHelpful: pretty much) in only a few hours. This will improve over releases
votesFunny: there's nothing interesting apart of building good-looking stuff and making hugefreakingfarms after you've reached a certain level in the game.\nThere's no story right now and when there will be
commentsCount: it won't be the biggest interest of the game. If you're only playing sandbox games to get feels
column16: look for another game.\n\nTL;DR : The game has lots of potential. It looks beautiful. It has an unique ambiance
column17: and is very coherent overall. Don't play it if you want advanced combat gameplay
column19: in the state as it is when I'm writing this message. If this review is a few months ago
column20: please verify the facts I'm stating - They're maybe not true now."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nEverything Starbound should have been.
voteText: 63 of 80 people (79%) found this review helpful 17 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros:
- Beautiful art, well pixelated textures.
- Everything in the system turned out great.
- Unique Quest Giver, it looks like a PlumBob, which is really cute (to me).
- Unique biomes, mobs.
- Lights up your surroundings (with a small radius) when putting light sources (to me it's torches) in hotbar, without actually holding it.
- Physics is important. Have you seen how a tree falls ? To the right, and the logs separated into rows. Unlike Terraria, which logs fall from above.
- TOO HARDCORE.
- Many promising upcoming features. (I hope we'll get a map since locating way back home was really hard.)

Cons:
- The speed when walking backwards is slow, maybe devs will increase it ?
- When having 1 block taller than the default ground, you can't automatically step on it without using Space (Jump) ?
- Underfined items ?? Give them names already, devs ! D:
- Remember when you Zoom x2 and the GUI got bigger, and you wouldn't be able to read all the words ? And opening Inventory when Zoom x2 is enabled takes up alot of your screen ? Yeah I hate that too Devs need to update the settings to tweak freely.
- The default Key Binding (Controls) is really frustating. Usually you have to re-enter the keys since you're not used to them.
- When changing a key, Skill UI stays the same. I change my control into WASD but some skill stay as Q+Q; Left Mouse + Q. Which confused me alot. Took me awhile to get used to it.
- Let's not forget about the resolution settings, shall we ? At the first time running the game, it glitches the fcked out of my screen. Auto-detected or something.
- Fullscreen borderless means nothing if you don't also tick the Fullscreen option. I ticked F.borderless and no fullscreen.
-You can't move the borderless window. What the hell dev ?

- This probably is a bug: No matter how much time you spend to customize your character, it'll always look as same as the Default male/female avatar. (Top left) My character has blonde hair yet the avatar displayed it blue.

- Probably another bug: Stuck at Magic quest 33% (Gather 8 wood, 6 wisp dust, craft enchanment book, make Fireball" spell
date:
etc.) I completed these above and yet no reward. Still stuck at 33%.

- Crashed while browsing Completed quests.

I'll continue to update this review
recommended: since I've only experienced the game for less than 20 hours."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've dipped my hand into just about every game (on steam) of this genre.
Though it had it's many faults i enjoyed Starbound quite a bit for what it was; and i think that it's not unfair to compare the two.
Even in Planet Centauri's current state, it outshines Starbound in more aspects than not.
I could go on about all the little things, like the in-depth crafting system and the intuitive combat; but the important part is {simply put} ~ it's just more fun.

I feel confident that if they can truly deliver on what they have planned out, this game could be something great - and i look forward to the future of Planet Centauri. *salute*

voteText: 12 of 13 people (92%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Not just a Terraria clone, but a very good Terraria clone which takes it's own spin on the formula and does it well.

I've been playing this on and off since the Beta, and out of all the many many games that tried to follow Terraria's success (Crea, Starbound, Edge of space, etc ), this is the one that shines above the others.

Fantastic art, enjoyable music and a more in depth and varied crafting system, including craftable spells.    Other positives are Pet taming, rescuing NPCs and manually setting them tasks/Jobs at your home, and small randomly found challenge portals.

The Developers have been consistently adding new content to the game, and now that it is finally in Early Access release I am very eager to see the further developments and content.  The biggest issue that seems to persist is that it's an Alt+Tab wiki" game.  Just like similar games of it's ilk you will find yourself alt tabbing to search for information and instructions on webpages instead of from within the game.

Is this better than Terraria?   No.  Terraria will always be number one to me.   But this game easily earns second place and does it with Style
helpfulPercent: 13 of 15 people (87%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When I first saw this game on Steam it looked like a copy of Starbound and/or Terraria. But unlike some people, I'm okay with a game using elements from other games I like. Instead of waiting for Starbound 1.0 or Terraria 2, I get to play a new game with a different team of devlopers taking it to it's own direction.

Out of the Early Access games I have (see my profile)  this is one of the most polished ones in terms of bugs. It isn't perfect but it's very much playable with very little interuption.

Combat is pretty straight forward and basic until you get transformations and tamed creatures. The transformations work like you'd expect, you gain the traints of that creature (including flying) and taming creatures is very similar to Pokemon in that you need higher tier capture items to capture certain ones (well pokemon is more RNG but it follows a similar concept on creature power vs. capture power. Oh, and there are custom spells. I'd love to see more 'types' added to how the elements work but the spells are indeed custom where you craft them with different stats like Speed
voteText:
etc..." all of which change the level of the spell and thus require higher gems you must find and craft in order to create the spell.

Content is still pretty lacking (when compared to Terraria and Starbound which have been worked on for years) but it's still enough to dig a solid few hours in and have an idea of where this game wants to go.

I'm really looking forward to see where this game goes as it feels like Terraria with Starbound's fancy elements. Both of which are things I like and want to see more of."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought this game directly from the Dev's site and my review is based on gameplay prior to it's release on Steam.

2D side scrolling.
Combat and ore mining.
Building and crafting.
Taming and transformation.
Farming and animals. (Chickens at the time of writing.)
Many different building blocks based on historical themes. (E.g Roman era.)
Attentive and helpful Dev.
Rising difficulty based on your location on the planet.
Quest and learning system.
Sucking out souls for personal gain.

These are just some of the reasons this game is awesome!

This game is utterly charming in it's own right and well worth a second glance. If you like the Terraria/Starbound genre of games then you will probably enjoy this one too.

Catch you in multiplayer!

The artstyle is pretty amazing and unique, it has the core a 2d sandbox game should have and more, you can capture pets, free villagers and assign them to do different stuff while still mining, fighting and get better gear.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Waited the game for nearly 2 years, supported on kickstarter, tried the demo and saw lots of potential in this game. Maybe in the first look you will think it's a Terraria clone but it has its own unique features, which make the game great and full with potential.
Pros :
-Awesome combat system.
-RPG elements.
-Unique monsters with rarity and different traits.
-Unique weapons with rarity and buffs (armors in future I think)
-Each monster has its own move animation, makes the game's combat system better, not just spamming left mouse and jumping around to fight monster.
-Nice building system.
-Good game's mechanic.
-Can create a living village with villagers.
-Most of monsters can be captured ( not bosses sadly :< )
-MAGIC CREATION system.
-And some features in the Road Map but they are not in the game yet.
Cons:
-Bugs ( can be fixed really fast if someone report them )
-Sadly the game is in EA and lacks of main features.
-In this version the game is a bit short for me.
WILL UPDATE THE REVIEW WITH THE GAME'S UPDATES

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When I first saw this game the features it offered along with its art style pulled me in fairly easily.

The game has your basic character creation system with gender selection, hair styles and colors, eye shape and colors, the usual.

The quests you receive act as your tutorial and cover pretty much everything you need to know. You might come across a few things you don't know but they are generally pretty easy to figure out.

The features that are in it currently are pretty fun to play with but are definitely works in progress.

In its current state, there are still bugs to be squashed and you'll find more than a few as you play.

All in all, this game has quite a journey ahead of it to get to the glory the Devs have promised. As it is, it's very much enjoyable and if you like games such as Terraria, Starbound, or Crea, or even if you've never played any game similar to this, I highly recommend this game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI have been following the development of this game and I was very happy that it was being brought to steam. I would recommend this game to friends but in current state I would not. This game is as it says early access. Combat in this game is only running forward and slashing hoping that you don't die. It moves too fast and it takes skill to stay alive for more than a couple seconds at night. I don't like the lack of a good crafting menu. It takes forever to scroll through all of the items and the alternative ways to craft them. The automatic cursor mode has problems. When you are breaking blocks ahead of you on a slope it takes some finagling and the blocks will not break the way you need them to on the first try. The resolution setting is buggy. This game's camera positioning is far away and everthing is small. When you change the resolution the game sometimes crashes. The skills that you attain with souls are a little too reachable. I unlocked them all in only a couple hours. Though I would have to say the thing that bothers me most is the way that you plant seeds You throw them? This is awful. They've already patched the game on the day of release. I see a dedication to a growing community from this company and I look forward to what this game will be. The seed thing won't kill me. I just wish that it was more accurate. The spouts are nearly impossible to see. So I can't tell if I skipped spaces until they start growing... The game is still playable and I could probably go on about little things wrong with it and what can be improved forever. This game is still enjoyable. This game definitely needs work but I think that with time this game can and will improve... I would give this game 3 stars... Not great... Not awful...
